Activity: Arrive at the office. Greet the team and check emails for urgent updates or requests. Grab a cup of coffee and catch up on team news.
Review this week's goals: physician examination workflow modification, influenza order sets implementation, and physician guideline awareness. Create a detailed task list for the week.
Meet with @ITPM-1 (IT Project Manager) to discuss project timelines and resource allocation for the influenza-related EHR modifications. Confirm priorities and potential roadblocks.

Email @EHRDEV-1, @EHRDEV-2 (EHR Integration Developers): Request update on progress with implementing the modifications on the EHR regarding the influenza diagnosis and testing prompts in the physician examination workflow. @EHRDEV-1, @EHRDEV-2 - can we schedule a quick meeting this afternoon to review this? @PCHMP-1 physician's inputs are required as well.
Research current influenza guidelines and recommendations from reputable sources (CDC, WHO) to ensure the EHR modifications are up-to-date. Take notes on key points.
Lunch break. Chat with colleagues in the break room.
Meet with @EHRDEV-1, @EHRDEV-2, and @PCHMP-1 to review the current state of EHR modifications for influenza diagnosis and testing. Discuss physician feedback and necessary adjustments to prompts.
Draft specifications for influenza testing order sets (influenza A/B PCR) and antiviral medication order sets. Consider dosage, frequency, and contraindications. Consult clinical resources as needed.

Email @RN-1, @RN-2, @RN-3 (Registered Nurses): Can you review the draft order sets for influenza testing and antiviral medications? Your input on clinical accuracy and usability is greatly appreciated. Please send your feedback by Wednesday COB.
Document progress on the EHR modification project. Prepare for tomorrow's tasks.
